text: Sydney Thomas 'Sid' Loudoun (1912-1973) was an Australian rugby league footballer who played in the 1930s. ==Playing career== Sid Loudoun (sometimes mis-spelt 'Louden") started with the St. George club in the early 1930s. He spent some time at Mudgee before returning to the Saints before badly breaking his leg Mudgee Guardian. LOUDEN Broken Leg 20/8/1934 https://trove.nla.gov.au/newspaper/article/161908209?searchTerm=louden%20sid&searchLimits;=l-state=New+South+Wales|||l-decade=193|||l-year=1934 during the 1934 season. He made a brief comeback 5 years later in 1939 before retiring. Whiticker/Hudson "THe Encyclopedia of Rugby League Players (1995) ==Death== Louden died on 7 Jan 1973.Sydney Morning Herald - Death Notice 8/1/1973 ==References== Category:St. George Dragons players Category:1912 births Category:1973 deaths Category:Australian rugby league players Category:Rugby league halfbacks
title: Sid Loudoun
